name: chinaberry
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an deciduous tree (= a tree that loses its leaves in autumn and grows new ones in the spring) that is part of the mahogany family and produces a small, yellow fruit. It has its origin in Asia and grows in the southern United States: Some homeowners find a Chinaberry to be an annoyance because of the berries that litter the ground beneath it. The sheep developed an appetite for invasive plants such as privet and chinaberry.
More examplesFewer examplesShe spent a lazy afternoon sipping lemonade and reading a book under the shade of a chinaberry tree.
